object.jcr:description:
My family and I just returned from a trip up to Yellowstone National Park. A family that hikes together stays together  All our kids are grown now, so we can do some of the more strenuous hikes. We decided to take on Sepulcher Mountain, an 11-mile, all-day hike with a 9,600’ summit. This was my first time on this trail, and I can’t even begin to tell you how beautiful it was.


We definitely chose to go at the right time of year. The leaves are absolutely incredible, and the fire season is far enough behind us that the air up there is crisp and clear as can be. Has anyone else hiked Sepulcher? If you are interested or have any questions about the hike, I would be happy to chat with you. One thing to consider: this is a cold hike.
